definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to hit the nail on the head (idiom)

sentences.english: The fair and impartial evaluation, also penetrating the.
sentences.chinese: 这些评价非常中肯，也都入木三分的。

sentences.english: Start by empathizing and end by advocating.
sentences.chinese: 开口语气要中肯强调，结束要拥护支持。

sentences.english: Nothing could be more pertinent at this point.
I thought he spoke very apropos.
Certainly the sources which explic jly mention the Essenes are pertinent.
sentences.chinese: 当然，来源，其中明确提到爱色尼是中肯的。

sentences.english: I think we can all appreciate the relevance of that now.
sentences.chinese: 我想，我们大家现在都能领会这句话中肯。

sentences.english: Many comments and suggestions in the report are very pertinent and insightful”.
sentences.chinese: 研究报告中提出的许多建议非常中肯。

sentences.english: This paper from the traditional festivals arises-whether differences between Chinese and western culture and arts.
sentences.chinese: 本文将从传统节日中肯感西文明差别取融合。

sentences.english: Thank you, Mr. Bjorn K. Haugland for your professional opinions and pertinent evaluations.
sentences.chinese: 感谢毕浩然先生的专业意见和中肯的评价。

sentences.english: They contain pertinent information on this topic.
sentences.chinese: 它们包含有关此主题的中肯意见。

sentences.english: The questions he raised during the discussion were all very much to the point.
sentences.chinese: 他在讨论会上提出的几个问题都十分中肯。

sentences.english: Make your comment relevant and you’re likely to receive some visitors from others who visit the same blog.
sentences.chinese: 作出中肯的评论可以为你带来浏览了同样博客的访客。

sentences.english: Certainly the sources which explicitly mention the Essenes are pertinent.
sentences.chinese: 当然，来源，其中明确提到爱色尼是中肯的。

sentences.english: His reasoning is perfectly sound, but he misses the point.
sentences.chinese: 他的推理完全正确，但是未切中肯綮。

sentences.english: All relevant sides have put up their pertinent suggestions and proposals for the document.
sentences.chinese: 有关各方已就该文件提出了中肯的意见和建议。

definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
to enjoy/to reap the benefits (of sth)
